titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Rockefeller Brothers Fund records FA1590

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 18:00:21 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Rockefeller Brothers Fund (RBF) was established in 1940 by the five sons of John D. Rockefeller Jr. and Abby Aldrich Rockefeller: John D. 3rd, Nelson A., Laurance S., Winthrop, and David Rockefeller, as a vehicle for the members of the Brothers generation to systematically coordinate their philanthropic giving as well as share consultants, advice, and resources. Its endowment was created through a gift from JDR Jr. in 1951, and a subsequent bequest from his estate in 1960. Abby Rockefeller Mauz√©, the eldest sibling and the only daughter of John D. Jr. and Abby Aldrich Rockefeller, joined the RBF Board in 1954.

John D. Rockefeller 3rd served as president of the Fund from its inception until 1956. Other past presidents have included: Nelson A. Rockefeller, 1956-1958; Laurance S. Rockefeller, 1958-1968; Dana S. Creel, 1968-1975; William M. Dietel, 1975-1987; and Colin G. Campbell, 1998-2000.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence, reports, memorabilia, program files, grant actions and grant administration files, Board of Trustees records, officers' files, photographs, and other material that document the philanthropic work of the Rockefeller Brothers Fund.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in eight record groups by record type. Each record group is comprised of multiple series, subseries or subgroups. Within records groups or series the material remains in original order. Additional finding aids are created as records are processed and open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection was donated to the Rockefeller Archive Center by the Rockefeller Brothers Fund in 2012.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center has title to the collection and has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection. Rockefeller Brothers Fund retains copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.
